intro: Crotalaria macilenta, commonly known as the slender cowpea, is a herbaceous annual plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are used in some traditional agricultural practices. Crotalaria macilenta is also noted for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
